page.title: 10EMPLOYMENT
page.content: Employment in Dornoch is varied. There are jobs in shops, services and craft workshops. The tourist trade brings seasonal jobs in hotels and catering, mainly for women and students. One of the main local employers is Grant and Sons Ltd. They employ about 50 workers in the slaughterhouse, mostly men, 3 long distance lorry drivers and 15 of a staff in the supermarket. The Water and Sewerage Dept. of the Council is based in Dornoch. Farming and Forestry provide employment for men, but there have been cutbacks in these areas. Many small crofts cannot fully support a tenant so another job is needed eg. with council or forestry. Many men were employed in the oil construction industry in Ross-shire, but were made redundant. It has bseen difficult for them to find jobs locally. Many young people leave the area to find jobs.
